metadata.title: CVE-2016-5735 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the rwpng_read_image24_libpng function in rwpng.c inpngquant 2.7.0 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via acrafted PNG file, which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pngquant - 2.5.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pngquant package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.0-2').
